event.desc: Severus was forced to flee Antioch because of his opposition to the Council of Chalcedon. He went first to Alexandria and then further into the desert. There he maintained his ascetic lifestyle.
While in exile, Severus came into conflict with Julian of Halicarnassus.
Theodosius was forced to flee Alexandria because of his opposition to the Council of Chalcedon.
Anthimus chose to exile himself from Constantinople when he learned that Severus and Theodosius had been exiled because of their opposition to the Council of Chalcedon.
Anthimus sent letters to Severus and Theodosius who sent synodical letters to him as well. They agreed to a union in opposition to the Council of Chalcedon.

Following the self-exile of Anthimus, Theodora hid him in one of her palaces. Only she and Anonymous 3768 and Anonymous 3769 knew about this. He remained in hiding for ten years, ending with the death of Theodora.

ab.note:
The length of time between Anthimus' deposition and Theodora's death was 12 years and John's Ecclesiastical History says that Anthimus was in hiding for only seven years.

event.desc: At the summons of Justinian, Severus traveled to Constantinople where he taught and advocated for the non-Chalcedonian cause. After two years he decided it was futile are returned to his exile outside Alexandria.
Severus fell ill and traveled to Ksoi where he died.

event.desc: Well known for his learning and holy way of life, Sergius became bishop of Antioch.
Sergius was ordained in Constantinople and passed the three years that he was patriarch of Antioch in exile in Constantinople.
Paul succeeded Sergius as the non-Chalcedonian patriarch of Antioch and spent his patriarchate in exile.
